required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Herbs and Spices on Metabolic Regulation and Appetite in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation on Effect of Herbs and Spices on Glucose and Insulin Responses, Anti-inflammatory Properties, Antioxidative Capacity and Satiety in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study was to investigate how herbs and spices affect acute/postprandial glucose and insulin responses, inflammatory markers, appetite control peptides, antioxidative capacity, as well as subjective appetite ratings (VAS-visual analogue scales) in healthy volunteers. We hypothesize that certain herbs and spices added to a standardized meal will improve postprandial glucose tolerance and other metabolic biomarkers in healthy volunteers, compared with a similar meal without the corresponding plant materials.

primary_outcome.measure: Changing on blood glucose concentration after treatment with herbs and spices
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 min and after intervention at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180 min.
primary_outcome.description: The capillary blood samples will be taken for blood glucose analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Changing on subjective appetite ratings after treatment with herbs and spices
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 min and after intervention at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180 min.
secondary_outcome.description: Appetite will be assessed using standard subjective 100 mm VAS (visual analogue scale) at time intervals throughout each visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Changing on metabolic biomarkers after treatment with herbs and spices
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 min and after intervention at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180 min.
secondary_outcome.description: The venous blood samples will be taken for insulin, inflammatory markers (i.e. interleukin-6, interleukin-8, tumor necrosis factor-alpha, necrosis factor kappa-beta, adiponectin and C-reactive protein), appetite biomarkers (i.e. ghrelin, cholecystokinin, glucagon-like peptide-1, gastric inhibitory polypeptide, peptide YY, amylin, pancreatic polypeptide)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changing on urine metabolite profile after treatment with herbs and spices
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 min and up to 24-h after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Metabolite profile will be analyzed using Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry based methods

secondary_outcome.measure: Changing on plasma metabolite profile after treatment with herbs and spices
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the initial intervention at 0 min and after intervention at 60, 90, 120, 180 min.
secondary_outcome.description: Metabolite profile will be analyzed using Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry based methods

arm_group.description: 200 ml test drink containing spices 1, acute study / one time administration
200 ml test drink containing spices 2, acute study / one time administration
200 ml test drink containing spices 3, acute study / one time administration
200 ml test drink containing herbs 1, acute study / one time administration
200 ml test drink containing herbs 2, acute study / one time administration
200 ml control drink, acute study / one time administration

intervention.description: In this study, subjects are asked to consume 200 ml beverage drinks contain certain amounts of spices 1. Following 10 min. beverage consumption, subjects will be given standardized breakfast corresponding to 50 g carbohydrate.

In this study, subjects are asked to consume 200 ml beverage drinks contain certain amounts of spices 2. Following 10 min. beverage consumption, subjects will be given standardized breakfast corresponding to 50 g carbohydrate.

In this study, subjects are asked to consume 200 ml beverage drinks contain certain amounts of spices 3. Following 10 min. beverage consumption, subjects will be given standardized breakfast corresponding to 50 g carbohydrate.

In this study, subjects are asked to consume 200 ml beverage drinks contain certain amounts of herbs 1. Following 10 min. beverage consumption, subjects will be given standardized breakfast corresponding to 50 g carbohydrate.

In this study, subjects are asked to consume 200 ml beverage drinks contain certain amounts of herbs 2. Following 10 min. beverage consumption, subjects will be given standardized breakfast corresponding to 50 g carbohydrate.
As a control, subjects are asked to consume 200 ml control drinks. Following 10 min. beverage consumption, subjects will be given standardized breakfast corresponding to 50 g carbohydrate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy males and females
- Signed informed consent
- BMI 20 - 28 kg/m2 with weight change <3 kg latest 2 months)
- Must be able to accept herbs and spices
Exclusion Criteria:
- Below 18 years
- Uncomfortable speaking English and/or difficulties in understanding spoken English
- Smoking or using snuff
- Vegetarian or vegan
- Stressed by venous blood sampling or previous experience of being difficult to cannulate
- Receiving any drug treatment that may influence the study outcomes
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding

facility.name: Antidiabetic Food Centre (Medicon Village) - Lund University
